# Related Apps

Below are links to some additional Shiny apps and/or R code that may also be useful for working with continuous sensor data. Some are stored on the <a href="https://nalms.shinyapps.io/NALMS_Shiny_Home/" data-once="external-links protected-links" target="_blank">NALMS Shiny server<svg class="icon icon--exit is-spaced-before" role="img"> == $0 <title>Exit EPA's website</title><use href="https://www.epa.gov/themes/epa_theme/images/sprite.svg#launch"></use></svg></a>.

### ContDataSumViz, for summarizing and visualizing QC’d continuous sensor data

Shiny app (beta version): <a href="https://contdataqcsumviz_containerized_stg.app.cloud.gov/" data-once="external-links protected-links" target="_blank">https://contdataqcsumviz_containerized_stg.app.cloud.gov/<svg class="icon icon--exit is-spaced-before" role="img"> == $0 <title>Exit EPA's website</title><use href="https://www.epa.gov/themes/epa_theme/images/sprite.svg#launch"></use></svg></a>

R code: <a href="https://github.com/USEPA/dmap-ContDataQCSumViz" data-once="external-links protected-links" target="_blank">https://github.com/USEPA/dmap-ContDataQCSumViz<svg class="icon icon--exit is-spaced-before" role="img"> == $0 <title>Exit EPA's website</title><use href="https://www.epa.gov/themes/epa_theme/images/sprite.svg#launch"></use></svg></a>

### Logger Processing App, for processing, organizing, and vetting continuous environmental logger data 

It has the same QC flag tests as ContDataQC plus more, including an interactive plot that allows you to flag or unflag data points.

Shiny app: <a href="https://nalms.shinyapps.io/logger_processing/" data-once="external-links protected-links" target="_blank">https://nalms.shinyapps.io/logger_processing/<svg class="icon icon--exit is-spaced-before" role="img"> == $0 <title>Exit EPA's website</title><use href="https://www.epa.gov/themes/epa_theme/images/sprite.svg#launch"></use></svg></a>

GitHub: <a href="https://github.com/mnsentinellakes/logger_processing" data-once="external-links protected-links" target="_blank">https://github.com/mnsentinellakes/logger_processing<svg class="icon icon--exit is-spaced-before" role="img"> == $0 <title>Exit EPA's website</title><use href="https://www.epa.gov/themes/epa_theme/images/sprite.svg#launch"></use></svg></a>

### LakeMonitoR, for summarizing and visualizing QC’d continuous vertical profile data for lakes 

Several of its outputs are based on the rLakeAnalyzer R package (see below).

Shiny app: <a href="https://nalms.shinyapps.io/LakeMonitoR/" data-once="external-links protected-links" target="_blank">https://nalms.shinyapps.io/LakeMonitoR/<svg class="icon icon--exit is-spaced-before" role="img"> == $0 <title>Exit EPA's website</title><use href="https://www.epa.gov/themes/epa_theme/images/sprite.svg#launch"></use></svg></a>

GitHub: <a href="https://github.com/leppott/LakeMonitoR/" data-once="external-links protected-links" target="_blank">https://github.com/leppott/LakeMonitoR/<svg class="icon icon--exit is-spaced-before" role="img"> == $0 <title>Exit EPA's website</title><use href="https://www.epa.gov/themes/epa_theme/images/sprite.svg#launch"></use></svg></a>

### rLakeAnalyzer, an R package for summarizing and visualizing continuous vertical profile data for lakes

Read, J.S., Hamilton, D.P., Jones, I.D., Muraoka, K., Winslow, L.A., Kroiss, R., Wu, C.H., Gaiser, E., 2011. Derivation of lake mixing and stratification indices from high-resolution lake buoy data. Environmental Modelling & Software 26: 1325e1336.

Winslow, L, J. Read, R. Woolway, J. Brentrup, T. Leach, J. Zwart, S.  Albers, and D. Collinge. 2019. rLakeAnalyzer: Lake Physics Tools. R Package version 1.11.4.1. 

Available online: <a href="https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=rLakeAnalyzer" data-once="external-links protected-links" target="_blank">https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=rLakeAnalyzer<svg class="icon icon--exit is-spaced-before" role="img"> == $0 <title>Exit EPA's website</title><use href="https://www.epa.gov/themes/epa_theme/images/sprite.svg#launch"></use></svg></a>

### driftR, an R package that corrects drift in water quality data

It implements either one- or two-point variable data corrections based on the number of standards used to calibrate the sensor of interest, then linearly interpolates the correction over the period of interest.

<a href="https://shaughnessyar.github.io/driftR/" data-once="external-links protected-links" target="_blank">https://shaughnessyar.github.io/driftR/<svg class="icon icon--exit is-spaced-before" role="img"> == $0 <title>Exit EPA's website</title><use href="https://www.epa.gov/themes/epa_theme/images/sprite.svg#launch"></use></svg></a>

Shaughnessy, A.R., Prener, C.G. and E.A. Hasenmueller. 2019. An R package for correcting continuous water quality monitoring data for drift. Environmental Monitoring and Assessment 191, 445. 
<a href="https://doi.org/10.1007/s10661-019-7586-x" data-once="external-links protected-links" target="_blank">https://doi.org/10.1007/s10661-019-7586-x<svg class="icon icon--exit is-spaced-before" role="img"> == $0 <title>Exit EPA's website</title><use href="https://www.epa.gov/themes/epa_theme/images/sprite.svg#launch"></use></svg></a>
